oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assembly of Fe3O4 nanoparficles on SiO2 monodisperse spheres
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BARICK, KC
BAHADUR, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: core-shell particles
magnetic core
microspheres
nanocomposites
dispersions
latex
fe3o4 nanoparticles
sio2 monodisperse spheres
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The assembly of superparamagnetic Fe3O4 nanoparticles on submicroscopic SiO2 spheres have been prepared by an in situ reaction using different molar ratios of Fe3+/Fe2+ (50-200%). It has been observed that morphology of the assembly and properties of these hybrid materials composed of SiO2 as core and Fe3O4 nanoparticles as shell depend on the molar ratio of Fe3+/Fe2+.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 1st Indo-Singapore Symposium on Advanced Functional Materials,Bombay, INDIA,FEB 24-26, 2006
